title: Light Alloys - Metallurgy of the Light Metals (5th Ed)(gnv64)
description: Light Alloys: Metallurgy of the Light Metals (5th Ed) By Ian Polmear, David StJohn, Jian-Feng Nie, Ma Qian Butterworth-Heinemann | April 2017 | ISBN-10: 0080994318 | PDF | 544 pages | 46.6 mb Recent years have seen significant advances in the processing and use of light alloys, in particular in the aeronautical and automotive industries, along with advances in modelling techniques, casting and fabricating technologies and environmental issues. Fully updated to cover all of these developments, the new edition is focused on the needs of both students and professionals working in this field, and is a key resource for both – including those who do not have a metallurgical background. • Covers the science, properties and applications of widely used engineering alloys in one volume, with new material on processing, heat treatment and characteristics of these essential alloys • Outlines the latest applications and processes in the automotive, aeronautical and related industries • Describes new developments with novel materials such as composites, metallic foams, quasi and nanocrystalline alloys CONTENTS Prefaces 1 - THE LIGHT METALS 2 - PHYSICAL METALLURGY OF ALUMINIUM ALLOYS 3 - CASTING OF LIGHT ALLOYS 4 - WROUGHT ALUMINIUM ALLOYS 5 - CAST ALUMINIUM ALLOYS 6 - MAGNESIUM ALLOYS 7 - TITANIUM ALLOYS 8 - NOVEL MATERIALSAND PROCESSING METHODS APPENDIX Index https://s26.postimg.org/cpb0kaxt5/Light_Alloys_-_Metallurgy_of_the_Light_Metals_5.jpg
